snippet: Seth Goldstein, 75, holds degrees in engineering and patents for biomedical innovations. But in retirement, he uses his engineering skills for whimsy and art.
abstract: Retiring column; growing number of retirees are using skills from their careers to pursue creative endeavors; former biomedical engineer Seth R Goldstein is prime example in that he uses his engineering background to create so-called kinetic sculptures that challenge limits of engineering and that he hopes will inspire younger generation of engineers.
lead_paragraph: Seth Goldstein, 75, holds degrees in engineering and patents for biomedical innovations. But in retirement, he uses his engineering skills for whimsy and art.

headline.print_headline: An Engineer Creates for Fun After a Lifetime of Workaday Rules
headline.main: An Engineer Creates for Fun After a Lifetime of Workaday Rules
